author: Soma Biswas
title: Murray Energy Opens Debt Talks With Bondholders
text:
Murray Energy Corp. is in talks with bondholders about extending its debt maturities in an effort to gain relief on high debt payments as more power companies shut down coal-fired plants, according to people familiar with the matter.
The Ohio-based company, in addition to interest payments on about $2.8 billion in debt, is also on the hook this year for hundreds of millions of dollars in health and other benefits for retired coal miners, the people said.
